definitions: To dress oneself in an item of clothing or accessory.
To activate or start a device, machine, or appliance.
To apply a substance to a surface.
To schedule or present a performance, show, or event.
To pretend or feign an emotion, accent, or attitude.
examples: She put on her new dress for the party.
Please put on the light; it's getting dark.
He put on some sunscreen before going to the beach.
The theater group is putting on a new play next month.
I've put on a few pounds over the holidays.
Don't put on an act; just be yourself.
